original_title: A Long Way from Home: The Untold Story of Baseball's Desegregation
overview: Jackie Robinson broke baseballâ€™s color line in 1947, but it took another generation of Black and Latino players to make the sport truly open to all. Playing in remote minor-league towns, these were the men who, before they could live their big-league dreams, first had to beat Jim Crow.
title: A Long Way from Home: The Untold Story of Baseball's Desegregation
